alert.note: Alert for Wet Mountains above 10000 Ft; Wet Mountains between 6300 and 10000Ft (Colorado) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 08 at 5:20PM MDT by NWS Pueblo
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of east central Custer County through 600 PM MDT... At 519 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over the western portion of the Junkins Burn Scar, moving south at 10 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This storm will remain over mainly rural areas of east central Custer County. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.

area.areaDesc: Wet Mountains above 10000 Ft; Wet Mountains between 6300 and 10000Ft
